channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Despite razor-thin margin, House speaker is optimistic partial shutdown will end soon
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson is voicing optimism that the House can quickly bring an end to the partial government shutdown, but he is dealing with a razor-thin majority and a restive GOP caucus.
item.content:encoded: Speaker Mike Johnson is voicing optimism that the House can quickly bring an end to the partial government shutdown, but he is dealing with a razor-thin majority and a restive GOP caucus.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Rep. Jim McGovern discusses the ongoing partial government shutdown
item.description: Rep. Jim McGovern, D- Mass., talks about the ongoing partial government shutdown and the negotiations over funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded: Rep. Jim McGovern, D- Mass., talks about the ongoing partial government shutdown and the negotiations over funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump says he will lower tariffs on India to 18%
item.description: President Trump says that he has agreed to a trade deal with India --- which will lower tariffs on the country to 18%.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says that he has agreed to a trade deal with India --- which will lower tariffs on the country to 18%.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Powerful people, random redactions: 4 things to know about the latest Epstein files
item.description: In the Justice Department's release of millions of pages of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, there are several instances of unredacted names of Epstein's accusers, raising concerns about privacy.
item.content:encoded:
In the Justice Department's release of millions of pages of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, there are several instances of unredacted names of Epstein's accusers, raising concerns about privacy.

(Image credit: Jon Elswick)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The partial shutdown enters its fourth day as debate over DHS funding continues, Iran and U.S. to negotiate over Iran's nuclear program, investigators continue search for mom of 'Today' show host.
item.content:encoded: The partial shutdown enters its fourth day as debate over DHS funding continues, Iran and U.S. to negotiate over Iran's nuclear program, investigators continue search for mom of 'Today' show host.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: 'We want our kids to be happy': School staff react to release of 5-year-old from ICE
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to two staff members of the Minnesota school attended by Liam Conejo Ramos, the 5-year-old boy who made headlines when he was detained by ICE.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to two staff members of the Minnesota school attended by Liam Conejo Ramos, the 5-year-old boy who made headlines when he was detained by ICE.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Melinda French Gates reacts to new details about Bill Gates in the Epstein files
item.description: In an interview on NPR's Wild Card podcast, Melinda French Gates reacts to her ex-husband, Bill Gates, being mentioned in the most recent release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: In an interview on NPR's Wild Card podcast, Melinda French Gates reacts to her ex-husband, Bill Gates, being mentioned in the most recent release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Community works to prevent evictions as fear of ICE keeps some immigrants from work
item.description: In Minneapolis, some immigrants who have not gone to work because they fear being detained by ICE are at risk of eviction. There's a growing number of grassroots efforts to provide rent relief.
item.content:encoded: In Minneapolis, some immigrants who have not gone to work because they fear being detained by ICE are at risk of eviction. There's a growing number of grassroots efforts to provide rent relief.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Iranians seeking to punish ruling elite go after the next best thing -- their kids
item.description: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.
item.content:encoded: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.
item.dc:creator: Arezou Rezvani

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing reopens, but few have been allowed to cross
item.description: Gaza's main border crossing reopened Monday after being closed for most of the war, but few people have been allowed to cross.
item.content:encoded: Gaza's main border crossing reopened Monday after being closed for most of the war, but few people have been allowed to cross.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
